Course Schedule

This page displays an outline of the topics, content, and assignments for the semester. Slides and assignment links will go live as the semester progresses.

Week Date Topic Reading Video Slides Skill Dataquest Assignment
1 Aug 30 Course overview Explore MS 365 & Dataquest
Sep 1 The economy and society 📖 🖥️ Understanding data 📉
2 Sep 6 Institutions and development 📖 🖥️ Using data 📉
Sep 8 Modernization theory 📖 🖥️ Analyzing data 📉
3 Sep 13 Democratic backsliding 📖 📺 🖥️ Importing data 📉
Sep 15 The resource curse 📖 📺 🖥️ Organizing data 📉 🧮
4 Sep 20 Women’s empowerment 📖 🖥️
Sep 22 Exam 1 review 🖥️ 📘
5 Sep 27 Programmatic politics vs. clientelism 📖 🖥️ Cleaning data I 📉
Sep 29 Vote buying 📖 🖥️ Cleaning data II 📉
6 Oct 4 Ethnicity and public goods 📖 📺 🖥️ Bar charts 📉
Oct 6 Democracy and redistribution 📖 📺 🖥️ Line charts 📉
7 Oct 11 Washington consensus reforms 📖 📺 🖥️ Scatter plots 📉
Oct 13 The gendered legacy of reform 📖 📺 🖥️ Maps 🧮
8 Oct 18 Populism and social policy 📖 🖥️
Oct 20 Exam 2 review 🖥️ 📘
9 Oct 25 No class-Fall break
Oct 27 Final project workshop (virtual) 📖 Writing with Zotero ✍️
10 Nov 1 Welfare states in the OECD 📖 📺 🖥️ Wrangling data in the Power Query Editor 📉
Nov 3 U.S. exceptionalism 📖 📺 🖥️ Upload data to Power BI 📉
11 Nov 8 Unions and collective bargaining 📖 📺 🖥️ Create column chart in Power BI 📉
Nov 10 Varieties of capitalism 📖 📺 🖥️ Create line chart in Power BI 📉
12 Nov 15 Globalization 📖 📺 🖥️ Create map in Power BI 📉
Nov 17 Inequality 📖 📺 🖥️ Create scatter plot in Power BI 📉
13 Nov 22 Final project workshop (virtual) ✍️
Nov 24 No class-Thanksgiving break
14 Nov 29 The populist backlash in the West 📖 🖥️
Dec 1 The rise of nationalism and socialism 📖 🖥️
15 Dec 6 Climate change and collective action 📖 🖥️
Dec 8 Exam 3 review 🖥️ 📘✍️
